name: send
trans: n. 上升运动

sentences.english: Lyn sent some pictures of the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 琳恩寄了几张婚礼照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: [sent-sent] 送， 寄； 派遣， 打发； 发送； 发射
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something to go or be taken to another place, especially by post

name: consciousness
trans: n. 意识；知觉；觉悟；感觉

sentences.english: The painful memories eventually faded from her consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 那些痛苦的回忆最终从她的意识中淡去了。

sentences.english: Hypnosis is an altered state of consciousness .
sentences.chinese: 催眠状态是一种被改变的意识状态。

sentences.english: research into human consciousness
sentences.chinese: 对人类意识的研究

detailed_translations.english: your mind and your thoughts

name: figurative
trans: adj. 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的

sentences.english: He’s my son, in the figurative sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 打个比方，他就像是我的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的
detailed_translations.english: a figurative word or phrase is used in a different way from its usual meaning, to give you a particular idea or picture in your mind

name: dawn
trans: n. 黎明；开端

sentences.english: When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.chinese: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

sentences.english: I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.english: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们从早干到晚。

sentences.english: the cold light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 清冷的晨曦

sentences.english: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
if day or morning dawns, it begins

name: hire
trans: n. 雇用，租用；租金，工钱

sentences.english: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
sentences.chinese: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。

sentences.english: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
sentences.chinese: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

sentences.english: a car hire company
sentences.chinese: 汽车租赁公司

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time

name: swap
trans: n. 交换；交换之物

sentences.english: a fair swap
sentences.chinese: 公平交换

sentences.english: We can do a swap if you like.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意我们可以交换。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you give something to someone and get another thing in return
to give something to someone and get something in return

name: shoot
trans: n. 射击；摄影；狩猎；急流

sentences.english: Police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them.
sentences.chinese: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。

sentences.english: Smith killed his wife, and then shot himself.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯杀死妻子，然后开枪自杀。

sentences.english: A woman was shot dead in an attempted robbery.
sentences.chinese: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

sentences.english: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight (= shoot them as soon as they see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately kill or injure someone using a gun
an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film

name: common
trans: n. 普通；平民；公有地

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: chef
trans: n. 厨师，大师傅

sentences.english: a master chef
sentences.chinese: 手艺高超的厨师长

sentences.english: a pastry chef
sentences.chinese: 糕饼师傅

detailed_translations.english: a skilled cook, especially the main cook in a hotel or restaurant

name: attrit
trans: 磨损

name: role
trans: n. 角色；任务

sentences.english: She has just landed the lead role in their latest production.
sentences.chinese: 她刚在他们最新的作品中取得了主角。

detailed_translations.english: the character played by an actor in a play or film

name: mention
trans: vt. 提到，谈到；提及，论及；说起

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: month
trans: n. 月，一个月的时间

sentences.english: I hope I’ll have finished the work by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我这个月底能完成工作。

sentences.english: She earns about £350 a month (= each month ).
sentences.chinese: 她每月约挣350英镑。

sentences.english: We update the schedule at least once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们至少每月更新一次日程表。

detailed_translations.english: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

name: alternative
trans: n. 二中择一；供替代的选择

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: fame
trans: n. 名声，名望；传闻，传说

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

name: nutrient
trans: n. 营养物；滋养物

sentences.english: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow

name: inbreed
trans: vt. 生育，生产

name: individualist
trans: n. 利己主义者，个人主义者

name: restriction
trans: n. 限制；约束；束缚

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: mysterious
trans: adj. 神秘的；不可思议的；难解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: serve
trans: n. 发球，轮到发球

sentences.english: There was only one girl serving customers .
sentences.chinese: 只有一个女孩在接待顾客。

detailed_translations.chinese: 招待，供应；为…服务；对…有用；可作…用
detailed_translations.english: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want
the action in a game such as tennis or  volleyball  when you throw the ball in the air and hit it over the net

name: professional
trans: n. 专业人员；职业运动员

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: occupy
trans: vt. 占据，占领；居住；使忙碌

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: covert
trans: n. 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛

sentences.english: covert operations
sentences.chinese: 秘密行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛
detailed_translations.english: a group of thick bushes where animals can hide

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的
detailed_translations.english: secret or hidden

name: temporary
trans: n. 临时工，临时雇员

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: thick
trans: n. 最拥挤部分；活动最多部分；事物的粗大浓密部分

sentences.english: a thick oak door
sentences.chinese: 一扇厚实的橡木门

sentences.english: a thick slice of homemade bread
sentences.chinese: 一片厚厚的自制面包

sentences.english: He was wearing thick glasses.
sentences.chinese: 他戴着厚厚的眼镜。

sentences.english: short thick fingers
sentences.chinese: 短粗的手指

sentences.english: thick wool socks (= socks that are heavy and warm )
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的羊毛袜子

sentences.english: If you want a thicker blanket, there are more here in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要更厚的毯子，这个柜子里还有。

sentences.english: The meat is done when the thickest part turns from pink to white.
sentences.chinese: 肉最厚的部分从粉红色变成白色，就说明熟了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

name: allow
trans: vi. 容许；考虑

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

name: technological
trans: adj. 技术的；工艺的

sentences.english: The steam engine was the greatest technological advance of the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机是19世纪最伟大的技术进步。

detailed_translations.english: related to technology

name: reactive
trans: adj. 反应的；电抗的；反动的

sentences.english: a reactive foreign policy
sentences.chinese: 回应式的外交政策

detailed_translations.english: reacting to events or situations rather than starting or doing new things yourself

name: huge
trans: adj. 巨大的；庞大的；无限的

sentences.english: a huge dog
sentences.chinese: 一条大狗

sentences.english: huge crowds
sentences.chinese: 大群大群的人

sentences.english: Your room’s huge compared to mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的房间跟我的比很大。

sentences.english: These shoes make my feet look huge.
sentences.chinese: 这双鞋让我的脚看上去大极了。

sentences.english: the huge scale of the problem
sentences.chinese: 该问题的严重性

detailed_translations.english: extremely large in size, amount, or degree

name: relative
trans: n. 亲戚；相关物；[语] 关系词；亲缘植物

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: deduction
trans: n. 扣除，减除；推论；减除额

sentences.english: Children will soon make deductions about the meaning of a word.
sentences.chinese: 儿童不久就能推断词义了。

detailed_translations.english: the process of using the knowledge or information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion, or the opinion that you form

name: spill
trans: n. 溢出，溅出；溢出量；摔下；小塞子

sentences.english: Katie almost spilled her milk.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂差点把牛奶洒出来。

detailed_translations.english: if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container
if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container

name: sample
trans: n. 样品；样本；例子

sentences.english: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

detailed_translations.chinese: 从…抽样； 品尝， 体验
detailed_translations.english: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like

name: subsidise
trans: vt. 给…津贴或补贴，资助或补助…

sentences.english: Now the questions are: why should northern European taxpayers be required to subsidise Greek voters given their failure to control their own government?
sentences.chinese: 现在的问题是：希腊的选民未能看管好自己的政府，为什么要北欧国家的纳税人去资助他们？

name: language
trans: n. 语言；语言文字；表达能力

sentences.english: How many languages do you speak?
sentences.chinese: 你能说几种语言？

sentences.english: one of the best-known poems in the English language
sentences.chinese: 最著名的英语诗歌之一

detailed_translations.english: a system of communication by written or spoken words, which is used by the people of a particular country or area

name: dastard
trans: n. 懦夫；卑鄙的人

name: ancient
trans: n. 古代人；老人

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: prosperity
trans: n. 繁荣，成功

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

name: baffle
trans: n. 挡板；困惑

sentences.english: The question baffled me completely.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…困惑；使…受挫折；用挡板控制
detailed_translations.english: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all

name: withstand
trans: vt. 抵挡；禁得起；反抗

sentences.english: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

name: underneath
trans: prep. 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下

sentences.english: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.english: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.english: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

sentences.english: He has on his jeans and a long-sleeved blue denim shirt with a white T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿牛仔裤和一件蓝色长袖粗斜纹棉布衬衫，里面还有件白色T恤衫。

sentences.english: The shooting-range is lit from underneath by rows of ruby-red light fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下
detailed_translations.english: directly under another object or covered by it
Underneath is also an adverb
the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

name: disappear
trans: vi. 消失；失踪；不复存在

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: moderation
trans: n. 适度；节制；温和；缓和

sentences.english: Some people think drinking in moderation can prevent heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为适量饮酒可以预防心脏病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和， 中庸； 适度， 合理

name: computer
trans: n. 计算机；电脑；电子计算机

sentences.english: a huge global computer network
sentences.chinese: 巨大的全球计算机网络

sentences.english: the latest computer software
sentences.chinese: 最新的计算机软件

detailed_translations.english: an electronic machine that stores information and uses programs to help you find, organize, or change the information

name: restore
trans: vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: deliver
trans: n. 投球

sentences.english: The morning mail has just been delivered.
sentences.chinese: 早晨的邮件刚送到。

sentences.english: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你们送货吗？

sentences.english: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

name: profound
trans: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: matchstick
trans: n. 火柴棍，火柴杆；火柴杆似的东西

name: threat
trans: n. 威胁，恐吓；凶兆

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: gradual
trans: n. 弥撒升阶圣歌集

sentences.english: There has been a gradual change in climate.
sentences.chinese: 气候渐渐发生了变化。

sentences.english: the gradual decline in manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 制造业的逐渐衰退

sentences.english: Education is a gradual process.
sentences.chinese: 教育是一个循序渐进的过程。

detailed_translations.english: happening slowly over a long period of time

name: rush
trans: n. 冲进；匆促；急流；灯心草

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.english: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: open
trans: adj. 公开的；敞开的；空旷的；坦率的；营业着的

sentences.english: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.english: an open window
sentences.chinese: 打开的窗户

sentences.english: The gates swung silently open.
sentences.chinese: 大门悄悄地打开了。

sentences.english: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.english: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
sentences.chinese: 所有的窗户都大开着。

sentences.english: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
sentences.chinese: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。

sentences.english: Jack opened the window.
sentences.chinese: 杰克打开窗户。

detailed_translations.english: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

name: include
trans: vt. 包含，包括

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

name: simple
trans: n. 笨蛋；愚蠢的行为；出身低微者

sentences.english: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。

sentences.english: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得卢克有点笨。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved

name: emphasise
trans: vt. （英）强调；加强…的语气（等于emphasize ）

sentences.english: I would emphasise three criteria.
sentences.chinese: 我想强调三条标准。

sentences.english: Many candidates go into interviews and are keen to emphasise their skills.
sentences.chinese: 在面试中，更多的候选人倾向于强调他们的专业技能。

sentences.english: They emphasise the significance of economic stability and social equality.
sentences.chinese: 他们强调了经济稳定、社会平等的重要性。

name: socialise
trans: vt. 使社会化；使社会主义化

sentences.english: Make time to socialise with friends – and also make time for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 抽时间进行社交——跟朋友聚聚，也是为自己抽出时间。

name: boost
trans: n. 推动；帮助；宣扬

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: departure
trans: n. 离开；出发；违背

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: admit
trans: vi. 承认；容许

sentences.english: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.english: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.english: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.chinese: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

name: begin
trans: vi. 开始；首先

sentences.english: As everybody’s here, let’s begin.
sentences.chinese: 大家都到齐了，我们就开始吧。

sentences.english: In the third year students begin the study of classical Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 学生在三年级开始学古代汉语。

sentences.english: The president begins talks with the prime minister tonight.
sentences.chinese: 总统将于今晚和首相展开会谈。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something
to start doing something

name: science
trans: n. 科学；技术；学科；理科

sentences.english: Many leading scientists do not consider that science can give absolutely reliable knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 许多杰出科学家都不认为科学能够提供绝对可靠的知识。

sentences.english: the founder of modern science, Isaac Newton
sentences.chinese: 现代科学创始人艾萨克·牛顿

sentences.english: developments in science and technology
sentences.chinese: 科学技术的发展

detailed_translations.english: knowledge about the world, especially based on examining, testing, and proving facts

name: aftermath
trans: n. 后果；余波

sentences.english: In the aftermath of the coup, the troops opened fire on the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 在那次政变的余波之中，军队向示威者开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time after something such as a war, storm, or accident when people are still dealing with the results

name: urban
trans: adj. 城市的；住在都市的

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: discipline
trans: n. 学科；纪律；训练；惩罚

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: heat
trans: n. 高温；压力；热度；热烈

sentences.english: Ice needs heat to melt.
sentences.chinese: 冰需要热才能融化。

sentences.english: Insulating the attic is a good way to reduce heat loss.
sentences.chinese: 为阁楼安装隔热层是减少热量流失的好方法。

sentences.english: The heat was making them tired.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的天气令他们疲倦。

sentences.english: Heat the milk until it boils.
sentences.chinese: 把牛奶煮开。

detailed_translations.english: warmth or the quality of being hot
to make something become warm or hot

name: intentional
trans: adj. 故意的；蓄意的；策划的

sentences.english: I did trip him, but it wasn’t intentional.
sentences.chinese: 我的确把他绊倒了，但不是故意的。

detailed_translations.english: done deliberately and usually intended to cause harm

name: fast
trans: n. 斋戒；绝食

sentences.english: a fast car
sentences.chinese: 速度很快的汽车

sentences.english: That can’t be the time - my watch must be fast.
sentences.chinese: 不可能是这个时间——一定是我的表快了。

sentences.english: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
sentences.chinese: 慢点——你开得太快了。

detailed_translations.english: moving or able to move quickly
moving quickly

name: stable
trans: n. 马厩；牛棚

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定；设想；担任；采取

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: depth
trans: n. [海洋] 深度；深奥

sentences.english: What's the depth of the water here?
sentences.chinese: 这儿的水有多深？

sentences.english: the depth of her love
sentences.chinese: 她那爱之深

sentences.english: Astronomers may one day travel to the depths of space.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家也许有一天可以到太空深处去。

detailed_translations.english: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of sth

name: technician
trans: n. 技师，技术员；技巧纯熟的人

sentences.english: a laboratory technician
sentences.chinese: 实验室技术人员

sentences.english: a hospital technician
sentences.chinese: 医院技术人员

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to check equipment or machines and make sure that they are working properly

name: journalism
trans: n. 新闻业，新闻工作；报章杂志

sentences.english: a career in journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作生涯

sentences.english: The hospital has been the target of investigative journalism(= journalism that examines an event or situation in order to find out the truth ).
sentences.chinese: 这家医院成了调查报道的目标。

detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of writing news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

name: spectrum
trans: n. 光谱；频谱；范围；余象

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: rammer
trans: 框架

name: undeniable
trans: adj. 不可否认的；公认优秀的；无可争辩的

sentences.english: undeniable proof
sentences.chinese: 确证

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可否认的, 无可辩驳的
detailed_translations.english: definitely true or certain

name: reverse
trans: n. 背面；相反；倒退；失败

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: social
trans: n. 联谊会；联欢会

sentences.english: social issues, such as unemployment and education
sentences.chinese: 失业和教育之类的社会问题

sentences.english: the country’s serious social problems
sentences.chinese: 该国严重的社会问题

sentences.english: a challenge to the social order
sentences.chinese: 对社会秩序的一个挑战

detailed_translations.chinese: 社会的； 交际的， 社交的
detailed_translations.english: relating to human society and its organization, or the quality of people’s lives

name: difficulty
trans: n. 困难，困境

sentences.english: They had great difficulty in finding a replacement.
sentences.chinese: 他们找接替的人费了很大劲

sentences.english: If you have any difficulties, give me a call.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遇到困难，就给我打电话。

sentences.english: She soon got into difficulty with debt.
sentences.chinese: 她很快就因债务陷入了困境。

detailed_translations.english: if you have difficulty doing something, it is difficult for you to do

name: problem
trans: n. 难题；引起麻烦的人

sentences.english: She was older than me, but that wasn’t really a problem.
sentences.chinese: 她比我年长，不过那不算什么问题。

sentences.english: She gave us 20 mathematical problems to solve.
sentences.chinese: 她让我们解20道数学题。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that causes difficulties

name: field
trans: n. 领域；牧场；旷野；战场；运动场

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

name: commonly
trans: adv. 一般地；通常地；普通地

sentences.english: Sodium chloride is more commonly known as salt.
sentences.chinese: 氯化钠通常都称为盐。

sentences.english: a commonly used industrial chemical
sentences.chinese: 一种常用的工业化学品

detailed_translations.english: usually or by most people

name: useful
trans: adj. 有用的，有益的；有帮助的

sentences.english: useful information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息

sentences.english: A little Japanese can be really useful.
sentences.chinese: 懂一点日语非常有用。

sentences.english: Can you come and make yourself useful(= help people to do something )?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能过来帮点忙？

detailed_translations.chinese: 有用的，有益的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: helping you to do or get what you want

name: colour
trans: n. 颜色；风格；气色，面色；外貌

sentences.english: Her eyes suddenly met his and she coloured slightly.
sentences.chinese: 她的目光突然和他相遇，她微微有点脸红了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…涂颜色，粉饰；歪曲；使脸红
detailed_translations.english: when someone colours, their face becomes redder because they are embarrassed

detailed_translations.chinese: 颜色；风格；气色，面色；外貌
detailed_translations.english: red, blue, yellow, green, brown, purple etc

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: particular
trans: n. 详细说明；个别项目

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

name: demographic
trans: adj. 人口统计学的；人口学的

sentences.english: In the same demographic breakdown of people may have different characteristics of the consumer mentality.
sentences.chinese: 处于同一人口统计细分的人们，可能具有不同的消费心态特征。

sentences.english: It is generally studied and mapped by an organization through lists and reportscontaining demographic information that may have an effect on the marketing of keyproducts or services.
sentences.chinese: 组织通常通过包含了可能对主要产品或服务的市场营销产生影响的人口统计信息的列表或包括来研究或划分它的。

name: rarely
trans: adv. 很少地；难得；罕有地

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

name: electronically
trans: adv. 电子地

detailed_translations.chinese: 电子地, 通过电子手段

name: region
trans: n. 地区；范围；部位

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

name: list
trans: n. [计] 列表；清单；目录

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

name: access
trans: n. 进入；使用权；通路

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: shallow
trans: n. [地理] 浅滩

sentences.english: a shallow river
sentences.chinese: 浅河

sentences.english: The lake is quite shallow.
sentences.chinese: 这湖很浅。

sentences.english: the shallow end of the pool
sentences.chinese: 游泳池的浅水区

sentences.english: Place the meat in a shallow dish.
sentences.chinese: 把肉放在一个浅盘里。

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a short distance from the top to the bottom

name: mammal
trans: n. [脊椎] 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: optimise
trans: vt. 使优化；充分利用

sentences.english: Even the positioning of a window to optimise daylight can help save energy.
sentences.chinese: 连充分利用日光的窗户都是节能的。

name: paradox
trans: n. 悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: chamber
trans: n. （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所

sentences.english: a combustion chamber
sentences.chinese: 燃烧室

sentences.english: The heart has four chambers.
sentences.chinese: 心脏有四个腔。

detailed_translations.chinese: （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所
detailed_translations.english: an enclosed space, especially in your body or inside a machine

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关在室内；装填（弹药等）

name: operational
trans: adj. 操作的；运作的

sentences.english: operational activities/costs/difficulties
sentences.chinese: 营运上的活动 / 成本 / 困难

sentences.english: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。

sentences.english: The new system became operational in March.
sentences.chinese: 新的系统于3月份启用。

sentences.english: Our main offices are now fully operational.
sentences.chinese: 我们的总部现已全面投入运营。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the operation of a business, government etc

name: hydrogen
trans: n. [化学] 氢

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: distinctive
trans: adj. 有特色的，与众不同的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

name: majority
trans: n. 多数；成年

sentences.english: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

name: trauma
trans: n. [外科] 创伤（由心理创伤造成精神上的异常）；外伤

sentences.english: traumas such as death or divorce
sentences.chinese: 死亡、离婚等的巨大痛苦

detailed_translations.english: an unpleasant and upsetting experience that affects you for a long time

name: speed
trans: n. 速度，速率；迅速，快速；昌盛，繁荣

sentences.english: I got caught speeding on the A40 yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我在 A40 号干线公路上超速行驶被逮到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰，迅速前进，急行；加速；超速行驶
detailed_translations.english: to be driving faster than the legal limit
the rate at which something moves or travels

detailed_translations.chinese: 快速传送； 促进， 使加速
detailed_translations.english: to take someone or something somewhere very quickly

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣，爱好；利息；趣味；同行

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: literal
trans: adj. 文字的；逐字的；无夸张的

sentences.english: In many cases, the people there are fighting, in a literal sense, for their homes.
sentences.chinese: 多数情况下，那里的人们实际上都是在为他们的家园而战斗。

detailed_translations.english: the literal meaning of a word or expression is its basic or original meaning

name: swim
trans: n. 游泳；漂浮；眩晕

sentences.english: Let’s go swimming this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午我们游泳去吧。

sentences.english: kids learning to swim the backstroke
sentences.chinese: 学习仰泳的孩子们

sentences.english: She was the first woman to swim the Channel.
sentences.chinese: 她是第一个游过英吉利海峡的女性。

detailed_translations.english: to move yourself through water using your arms and legs
a period of time that you spend swimming

name: photography
trans: n. 摄影；摄影术

sentences.english: He did fashion photography for ‘Vogue’ magazine.
sentences.chinese: 他为《时尚》杂志拍过时装照片。

sentences.english: the National Museum of Photography
sentences.chinese: 国家摄影博物馆

detailed_translations.english: the art, profession, or method of producing photographs or the scenes in films

name: plant
trans: n. 工厂，车间；植物；设备；庄稼

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

name: diffident
trans: adj. 羞怯的；缺乏自信的；谦虚谨慎的

sentences.english: John was as bouncy and ebullient as Helen was diffident and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 约翰活泼、热情；而海伦却羞怯、矜持。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞怯的；缺乏自信的；谦虚谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: shy and not wanting to make people notice you or talk about you

name: generate
trans: vt. 使形成；发生；生殖；产生物理反应

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: concrete
trans: n. 具体物；凝结物

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: perception
trans: n. 知觉；[生理] 感觉；看法；洞察力；获取

sentences.english: And when they do, what do you think their perception will be?
sentences.chinese: 当他们这样做时，你觉得他们的知觉是怎样的？

detailed_translations.english: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

name: revolutionise
trans: vt. 使彻底变革

name: craft
trans: n. 工艺；手艺；太空船

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

sentences.english: arts and crafts
sentences.chinese: 手工艺

detailed_translations.english: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do
to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

name: vary
trans: vi. 变化；变异；违反

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: factory
trans: n. 工厂；制造厂；代理店

sentences.english: a car factory
sentences.chinese: 汽车制造厂

sentences.english: factory workers
sentences.chinese: 工厂工人

detailed_translations.english: a building or group of buildings in which goods are produced in large quantities, using machines

name: objective
trans: adj. 客观的；目标的；宾格的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: electronics
trans: n. 电子学；电子工业

sentences.english: an electronics engineer
sentences.chinese: 电子工程师

detailed_translations.english: the study or industry of making equipment, such as computers and televisions, that work electronically

name: obey
trans: vt. 服从，听从；按照……行动

sentences.english: The little boy made no effort to obey.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩不肯服从。

sentences.english: ‘Sit!’ he said, and the dog obeyed him instantly.
sentences.chinese: “坐下！”他说道，那只狗马上就服从了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do

name: heavy
trans: n. 重物；严肃角色

sentences.english: The wardrobe was too heavy for me to move on my own.
sentences.chinese: 衣橱太重，我一个人移不动。

sentences.english: a heavy suitcase
sentences.chinese: 沉重的手提箱

sentences.english: The males are seven times heavier than the females.
sentences.chinese: 雄性的重量是雌性的七倍。

sentences.english: Heavy rain has caused flooding in many areas.
sentences.chinese: 大雨在很多地区造成水灾。

sentences.english: The apple trees were heavy with fruit.
sentences.chinese: 苹果树上果实累累。

detailed_translations.english: weighing a lot

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: glean
trans: vt. 收集（资料）；拾（落穗）

sentences.english: At present we're gleaning information from all sources.
sentences.chinese: 目前我们正从所有渠道慢慢收集信息。

detailed_translations.english: to collect grain that has been left behind after the crops have been cut

name: workplace
trans: n. 工作场所；车间

sentences.english: ...the difficulties facing women in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: …妇女在工作场所中面临的困难。

detailed_translations.english: the room, building etc where you work

name: control
trans: n. 控制；管理；抑制；操纵装置

sentences.english: Police had to be called in to control the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 只好调来警察控制人群。

sentences.english: He controlled the urge to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他克制住笑的冲动。

sentences.english: The disease robs you of muscle control.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病会让你丧失肌肉控制力。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something do what you want, or make something happen in the way that you want
the ability or power to make someone or something do what you want or make something happen in the way you want

name: facility
trans: n. 设施；设备；容易；灵巧

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: happen
trans: vi. 发生；碰巧；偶然遇到

sentences.english: When did the accident happen?
sentences.chinese: 事故什么时候发生的？

sentences.english: It’s impossible to predict what will happen next.
sentences.chinese: 不可能预测接下来会发生什么。

sentences.english: She carried on as if nothing had happened.
sentences.chinese: 她继续干，似乎什么都未曾发生。

sentences.english: This was bound to happen sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 这事注定早晚会发生。

sentences.english: This kind of thing happens all the time.
sentences.chinese: 这种事一直在发生。

sentences.english: As it happens, I know someone who might be able to help.
sentences.chinese: 真巧，我正好认识一个人，这个人也许帮得上忙。

sentences.english: We happened to discover we had a friend in common.
sentences.chinese: 我们碰巧发现我们有个共同的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned

name: important
trans: adj. 重要的，重大的；有地位的；有权力的

sentences.english: a very important meeting
sentences.chinese: 很重要的会议

sentences.english: The accident taught him an important lesson.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。

sentences.english: Happiness is more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 快乐比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
sentences.chinese: “你说什么？”“噢，没什么大事。”

sentences.english: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
sentences.chinese: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

sentences.english: a very important customer
sentences.chinese: 一位大客户

detailed_translations.english: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

name: source
trans: n. 来源；水源；原始资料

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: get
trans: n. 生殖；幼兽

sentences.english: We need to get help quickly!
sentences.chinese: 我们需要马上得到帮助！

sentences.english: It would be a good idea to get professional advice.
sentences.chinese: 征求专业人士的意见，这个主意很好。

sentences.english: You may be able to get a grant from the local authority.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以从当地政府获得拨款。

sentences.english: He cleared his throat to get our attention.
sentences.chinese: 他清清嗓子来引起我们的注意。

sentences.english: What time will we get there?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候可以到那里？

sentences.english: We got to Paris that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我们到了巴黎。

sentences.english: She soon got bored with the job.
sentences.chinese: 她不久就厌倦了这份工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 获得，得到；到达；变成，成为
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by finding it, asking for it, or paying for it

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: burn
trans: n. 灼伤，烧伤；烙印

sentences.english: I burnt all his old letters.
sentences.chinese: 我把他以前的信全烧了。

sentences.english: Cars were burned and shops were looted during the rioting.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱期间，汽车被焚，商店遭抢劫。

sentences.english: The Grand Hotel had burnt to the ground .
sentences.chinese: 格兰德大酒店被大火夷为平地。

sentences.english: Make sure the iron isn’t too hot or you’ll burn the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 注意熨斗温度不能过高，免得烫坏布料。

sentences.english: He dropped his cigarette and burnt a hole in the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 他的香烟掉下来，把地毯烫了一个洞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧；烧毁，灼伤；激起…的愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or damage something with fire
an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

name: tremendous
trans: adj. 极大的，巨大的；惊人的；极好的

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: layer
trans: n. 层，层次；膜；[植]压条；放置者，计划者

sentences.english: He pulled off layer upon layer of clothing (= many layers of clothing ).
sentences.chinese: 他把衣服一件件地脱掉。

detailed_translations.english: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

name: extreme
trans: n. 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: patriotism
trans: n. 爱国主义；爱国心，爱国精神

sentences.english: He was a country boy who had joined the army out of a sense of patriotism and adventure.
sentences.chinese: 他是个乡下小伙子，出于爱国心和冒险精神参了军。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱国主义；爱国心，爱国精神
detailed_translations.english: Patriotism is love for your country and loyalty toward it

name: stabilise
trans: vt. 使…坚固；使…安定；装稳定器（等于stablize）

sentences.english: However, after three weeks of cold exposure, body weight began to stabilise.
sentences.chinese: 不过，暴露在寒冷中三周后，体重就开始稳定下来。

sentences.english: But these will not stabilise levels of atmospheric carbon dioxide — only slow the rate of increase.
sentences.chinese: 但是这无法稳定大气中的二氧化碳水平——而只能降低增加的速率。

name: devotion
trans: n. 献身，奉献；忠诚；热爱

sentences.english: her devotion to duty
sentences.chinese: 她对职责的忠诚

sentences.english: Her devotion to the job left her with very little free time.
sentences.chinese: 她全身心投入工作，几乎没有闲暇。

detailed_translations.english: the action of spending a lot of time or energy on sth

name: quantitative
trans: adj. 定量的；量的，数量的

sentences.english: We need to do a proper quantitative analysis of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要对这个问题作一个正确的定量分析。

detailed_translations.english: relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of something

name: donor
trans: n. 捐赠者；供者；赠送人

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: tiny
trans: adj. 微小的；很少的

sentences.english: a tiny community in the Midwest
sentences.chinese: 中西部地区一个极小的社区

sentences.english: The earrings were tiny.
sentences.chinese: 耳环很小。

sentences.english: a tiny little baby
sentences.chinese: 丁点大的婴儿

sentences.english: She always felt a tiny bit sad.
sentences.chinese: 她总是感到一丝悲伤。

sentences.english: Bad teachers are a tiny minority .
sentences.chinese: 差老师只占极少数。

sentences.english: tiny pieces of paper
sentences.chinese: 碎纸屑片

detailed_translations.english: extremely small

name: rash
trans: n. [皮肤] 皮疹；突然大量出现的事物

sentences.english: Please Jessie, don’t do anything rash.
sentences.chinese: 求你了，杰西，不要草率行事。

sentences.english: Don’t go making any rash decisions about your future!
sentences.chinese: 不要对你的未来贸然作决定！

sentences.english: It was rather rash of you to lend them your car.
sentences.chinese: 你把汽车借给他们实在有欠考虑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；鲁莽的；不顾后果的
detailed_translations.english: if you are rash, you do things too quickly, without thinking carefully about whether they are sensible or not

detailed_translations.chinese: [皮肤] 皮疹；突然大量出现的事物
detailed_translations.english: a lot of red spots on someone’s skin, caused by an illness

name: widely
trans: adv. 广泛地

sentences.english: The quality of the applicants varies widely.
sentences.chinese: 申请人的素质差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: to a large degree – used when talking about differences

name: perfect
trans: n. 完成式

sentences.english: His English was perfect.
sentences.chinese: 他的英语很地道。

sentences.english: The car was in perfect condition.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车的车况极佳。

sentences.english: You’re very lucky to have perfect teeth.
sentences.chinese: 你能拥有一口完美的牙齿太幸运了。

sentences.english: a perfect performance
sentences.chinese: 完美的演出

sentences.english: In a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
sentences.chinese: 在理想世界中，我们不需要军队。

detailed_translations.english: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage

name: overlap
trans: n. 重叠；重复

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: lay
trans: vt. 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷

sentences.english: He laid his hand on my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他把一只手搭在我的肩上。

sentences.english: They laid a wreath at the place where so many people died.
sentences.chinese: 他们在这么多人丧生的地方放了一个花圈。

sentences.english: Lay the material flat on the table.
sentences.chinese: 把布料平铺在桌上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: not trained or not knowing much about a particular profession or subject

detailed_translations.chinese: 位置；短诗；花纹方向；叙事诗；性伙伴
detailed_translations.english: a poem or song

name: work
trans: n. 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品

sentences.english: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 每年这个时候工作机会都不多。

sentences.english: He’s been out of work (= without a job ) for two years.
sentences.chinese: 他失业有两年了。

sentences.english: More people are in work (= have a job ) than ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money

detailed_translations.chinese: 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进
detailed_translations.english: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job

name: different
trans: adj. 不同的；个别的，与众不同的

sentences.english: The place looks completely different now.
sentences.chinese: 这地方现在完全变了。

sentences.english: They decided to try a radically different approach.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。

sentences.english: We found women had significantly different political views from men.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。

sentences.english: a slightly different way of doing things
sentences.chinese: 稍有区别的做事方法

sentences.english: What actually happened was subtly different from the PR people’s version.
sentences.chinese: 实际情况与公关部那些人的说法有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The show is refreshingly different from most exhibitions of modern art.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样，令人耳目一新。

sentences.english: The publishing business is no different from any other business in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 从这一点来讲，出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。

sentences.english: It’s a different world here in London.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦这儿的情况完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: not like something or someone else, or not like before

name: critically
trans: adv. 精密地；危急地；严重地；批评性地；用钻研眼光地；很大程度上；极为重要地

sentences.english: Mike looked at her critically.
sentences.chinese: 迈克挑剔地打量着她。

sentences.english: He has spoken critically of the government’s refusal to support the industry.
sentences.chinese: 他谈到政府拒绝支持这个行业时颇有微词。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that shows you are criticizing someone or something

name: weird
trans: n. （苏格兰）命运；预言

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: browser
trans: n. [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人

sentences.english: a Web browser
sentences.chinese: 网页浏览器

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人
detailed_translations.english: a computer program that finds information on the Internet and shows it on your computer screen

name: swift
trans: n. 褐雨燕

sentences.english: My letter received a swift reply.
sentences.chinese: 我的信很快就得到了回复。

sentences.english: She shot a swift glance at Paul.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速瞥了保罗一眼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done quickly and immediately

name: awake
trans: adj. 醒着的

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

name: stir
trans: n. 搅拌；轰动

sentences.english: Give that pan a stir , will you?
sentences.chinese: 把那锅东西搅一搅，好吗？

detailed_translations.english: an act of stirring something
to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

name: whatever
trans: conj. 无论什么

sentences.english: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.
sentences.chinese: 凡是与科学有关的她都没有表现出任何兴趣。

sentences.english: This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一场无聊的争论，和你的工作没有任何关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: [用于否定句中以加强语气]任何； 无论什么
detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a negative statement

name: fundamental
trans: n. 基本原理；基本原则

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: adaptable
trans: adj. 适合的；能适应的；可修改的

sentences.english: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

detailed_translations.english: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations

name: exception
trans: n. 例外；异议

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: inflation
trans: n. 膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: dramatically
trans: adv. 戏剧地；引人注目地

name: distinction
trans: n. 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: embrace
trans: n. 拥抱

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: offspring
trans: n. 后代，子孙；产物

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: innovator
trans: n. 改革者，创新者

sentences.english: He is an innovator in this field.
sentences.chinese: 他是这个领域的革新者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who introduces changes and new ideas

name: cheap
trans: adj. 便宜的；小气的；不值钱的

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票

sentences.english: the cheapest TV on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上最便宜的电视机

sentences.english: Property is cheaper in Spain than here.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的房地产比这里便宜。

sentences.english: a cheap shop (= one that sells goods cheaply )
sentences.chinese: 廉价商店

sentences.english: The equipment is relatively cheap and simple to use.
sentences.chinese: 这种设备相对比较便宜，而且操作简单。

sentences.english: Cheap wine gives me a headache.
sentences.chinese: 我喝劣质的葡萄酒会头痛。

detailed_translations.english: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected

name: explore
trans: vi. 探索；探测；探险

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: wander
trans: vi. 徘徊；漫步；迷路；离题

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: massive
trans: adj. 大量的；巨大的，厚重的；魁伟的

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: except
trans: conj. 除了；要不是

sentences.english: They were all there except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外他们都在那里。

sentences.english: We all went except him.
sentences.chinese: 除他以外， 我们都去了。

sentences.english: They all howled with laughter except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外，他们全都哈哈大笑起来。

name: individuality
trans: n. 个性；个人；个人特征；个人的嗜好（通常复数）

sentences.english: We like our staff to show their individuality rather than wear a uniform.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢员工穿出个性，而不是穿制服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 个性；个人；个人特征；个人的嗜好（通常复数）
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone or something different from other things or people

name: system
trans: n. 制度，体制；系统；方法

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: envision
trans: vt. 想象；预想

sentences.english: I envisioned a future of educational excellence.
sentences.chinese: 我展望了一个有着优质教育的未来。

detailed_translations.english: to imagine something that you think might happen in the future, especially something that you think will be good

name: success
trans: n. 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物
detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

name: neighbour
trans: n. n. 邻居;同胞；仁慈的人

sentences.english: One of the neighbors complained about the noise from the party.
sentences.chinese: 有位邻居抱怨聚会太吵。

sentences.english: FBI agents were interviewing all their friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 联邦调查局人员正在向他们所有的朋友和邻居问话。

sentences.english: Our next-door neighbours (= the people who live in the house next to us ) say they’ll look after our cat for us while we’re away.
sentences.chinese: 我们隔壁的邻居说，我们不在时他们会照顾我们的猫。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives next to you or near you

name: density
trans: n. 密度

sentences.english: areas of high population density
sentences.chinese: 人口密度高的地区

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

name: ready
trans: n. 现款；预备好的状态

sentences.english: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
sentences.chinese: 快点，你还没准备好吗？

sentences.english: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
sentences.chinese: 门铃响的时候，他已经准备好在等着了。

sentences.english: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
sentences.chinese: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

sentences.english: He's always ready to help his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐意帮助朋友。

detailed_translations.english: fully prepared for what you are going to do

name: improvement
trans: n. 改进，改善；提高

sentences.english: Our results have shown some improvement this month.
sentences.chinese: 我们的成绩这个月有所提高。

sentences.english: Are you making some improvements to your home?
sentences.chinese: 你在改善家里的居住条件吗？

detailed_translations.english: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

name: convergence
trans: n. [数] 收敛；会聚，集合

sentences.english: With convergence to an ideal state, you can expect the system to be in or near that ideal state.
sentences.chinese: 通过收敛到一种理想状态，您可以期望系统处于或接近那一理想状态。

name: convey
trans: vt. 传达；运输；让与

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: depression
trans: n. 沮丧；洼地；不景气；忧愁；低气压区

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: planet
trans: n. 行星

sentences.english: The picture shows six of the nine planets in the solar system.
sentences.chinese: 这张图片展示太阳系9个行星中的6个行星。

detailed_translations.english: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.

name: dispersal
trans: n. 分散；传播；散布；疏散；消失

sentences.english: the role of birds in the dispersal of seeds
sentences.chinese: 鸟类对传播种子的作用

detailed_translations.english: the process of spreading things over a wide area or in different directions

name: education
trans: n. 教育；培养；教育学

sentences.english: She also hopes her children will get a good education.
sentences.chinese: 她也希望她的孩子可以受到良好的教育。

sentences.english: efforts to improve girls’ access to education
sentences.chinese: 为增加女孩受教育机会所作的努力

detailed_translations.english: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university

name: conservative
trans: n. 保守派，守旧者

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

name: electronic
trans: adj. 电子的

sentences.english: electronic games
sentences.chinese: 电子游戏

sentences.english: an electronic organizer (= a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc )
sentences.chinese: 电子记事本

detailed_translations.english: electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc

name: mode
trans: n. 模式；方式；风格；时尚

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: volume
trans: n. 量；体积；卷；音量；大量；册

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: explosion
trans: n. 爆炸；爆发；激增

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately causing sth to explode

name: root
trans: n. 根；根源；词根；祖先

sentences.english: tree roots
sentences.chinese: 树根

sentences.english: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
to grow roots

name: clot
trans: n. [生理] 凝块

sentences.english: The patient's blood refused to clot.
sentences.chinese: 病人的血液无法凝结。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid such as blood or milk clots, or if something clots it, it becomes thicker and more solid
a thick almost solid mass formed when blood or milk dries

name: discovery
trans: n. 发现，发觉；被发现的事物

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

name: gap
trans: n. 间隙；缺口；差距；分歧

sentences.english: ...the gap between rich and poor.
sentences.chinese: …贫富差距。

detailed_translations.english: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc

name: identical
trans: n. 完全相同的事物

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: heart
trans: n. 心脏；感情；勇气；心形；要点

sentences.english: Regular exercise is good for the heart.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼对心脏有好处。

sentences.english: Can you hear my heart beating?
sentences.chinese: 你能听见我的心跳吗？

sentences.english: Her cheeks were hot and her heart was pounding.
sentences.chinese: 她脸颊发烫，心怦怦直跳。

sentences.english: My heart raced. Were we going to land safely?
sentences.chinese: 我心跳得厉害。我们能安全着陆吗？

sentences.english: Daniel had no history of heart problems.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔没有心脏病史。

sentences.english: She suffers from a rare heart condition.
sentences.chinese: 她患有罕见的心脏病。

sentences.english: His breathing and heart rate were now normal.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸和心率现在都正常了。

detailed_translations.english: the organ in your chest which pumps blood through your body

name: invest
trans: vi. 投资，入股；花钱买

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

name: rely
trans: vi. 依靠；信赖

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: million
trans: n. 百万；无数

sentences.english: The book sold more than a million copies.
sentences.chinese: 这本书售出了一百多万册。

sentences.english: I’ve got a million ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我主意多得很。
